fdd_rule.name: Exhaust Fan VFD Speed Mismatch
fdd_rule.description: Exhaust Fan VFD command and feedback do not match
fdd_rule.problem: Lead to disturbance in proper air extraction and end user dissatisfaction
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Communication/Sensor calibration error

fdd_rule.name: Sensible Heat Wheel Improper Run
fdd_rule.description: SHW is running even when the required conditions are not met.
fdd_rule.problem: Disturb the overall thermal balance of the system and increased energy usage
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Due to miscalibration of temperature and/or humidity sensors.

fdd_rule.name: Supply Fan VFD Speed Mismatch
fdd_rule.description: Supply Fan VFD command and feedback do not match
fdd_rule.problem: Lead to disturbance in proper air extraction and end user dissatisfaction
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Communication/Sensor calibration error

fdd_rule.name: Supply Fan Bearing Not Lubricated
fdd_rule.description: Supply fan motor vibrations more than the threshold limit indicating requirement of bearing lubrication
fdd_rule.problem: More power consumption and can also lead to fan failure.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Lack of lubrication in the fan bearings can lead to excessive vibrations.
fdd_rule.threshold_metric_display: Supply Fan Motor Drive End Vibration

fdd_rule.name: AHU Over Cooling
fdd_rule.description: Supply air temperature is less than supply air temperature set-point by 95% for at least 300 seconds.
fdd_rule.problem: Leads to Over cooling of the spaces and also increases the energy consumption
fdd_rule.possible_causes:
1.Due to improper run of Enthalpy wheel
2.Cooling coil actuator is open when not required

fdd_rule.name: Enthalpy Wheel Improper Run
fdd_rule.description: EHW is running even when the required conditions are not met
fdd_rule.problem: May overcool and dehumidify the already cool outside air which can disturb the thermal balance of the system and lead to end user dissatisfaction
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Due to miscalibration of temperature and/or humidity sensors

fdd_rule.name: Exhaust Fan Improper Run
fdd_rule.description: Exhaust Fan is running when commanded OFF or when Supply air fan is commanded OFF
fdd_rule.problem: Exhaust fan running without dampers open and supply fan ON can lead to negative air pressure in the served spaces
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Issue with the relevant sensors or differential pressure switches

fdd_rule.name: Cooling Valve Stuck Closed/ Clogged
fdd_rule.description: Cooling coil valve is stuck at a position or fail to open due to clogging
fdd_rule.problem: Lead to energy wastage or over cooling too
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Due to clogging of cooling coil valve with dirt or debris because of which the motion of the valve actuator is hampered.
fdd_rule.possible_solution:
1.Inspect the cooling coil valve for any dirt/debris buildup 
 2.Check the electrical contacts of the actuator

fdd_rule.name: Cooling Valve Actuator Improper Function
fdd_rule.description: Cooling coil valve is not following the command
fdd_rule.problem: Due to which there may be overcooling or undercooling issues
fdd_rule.possible_causes: This may happen if the cooling valve actuator feedback is different from the command due to physical issues or sensor/signal receiving issues.
fdd_rule.possible_solution:
1.Inspect the cooling coil valve for any dirt/debris buildup. 
 2. Check the electrical contacts of the actuator.

fdd_rule.name: Cooling Actuator Faulty Closed
fdd_rule.description: Cooling coil valve actuator is not opening even when the supply air temperature and humidity is higher than the set-point
fdd_rule.problem: The end user will face discomfort due to under cooling and high humidity
fdd_rule.possible_causes:
1.If the cooling coil valve actuator is stuck (because of debris or broken electrical contact)
2.Not receiving command.
fdd_rule.possible_solution:
1.Inspect the cooling coil valve for any dirt/debris buildup 
 2. Check the electrical contacts of the actuator.

fdd_rule.name: Cooling Actuator Faulty Open
fdd_rule.description: Cooling coil valve actuator is open even when the supply air temperature is below set-point
fdd_rule.problem: The end user may feel extreme cold and dryness and also lead to wastage of energy.
fdd_rule.possible_causes:
1.This may happen if the cooling coil valve actuator is stuck at partially open or 100% open position (because of debris or broken electrical contact)
2.Not receiving command.
fdd_rule.possible_solution:
1.Inspect the cooling coil valve for any dirt/debris buildup 
 2.Check the electrical contacts of the actuator

fdd_rule.name: Cooling Coil Dirty
fdd_rule.description: Cooling coil airflow pressure drop more than the threshold.
fdd_rule.problem: 1. Reduced airflow due to dirt and debris blockages means reduced comfort for end user. 2. The blower must work harder and use more electricity to pull airflow through the blocked coil passages. 3. A dirty coil can contaminate supply ducts and reintroduce contaminants to spaces, including mold development and spores.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: During the cooling process, condensate forms on the coil. The condensate makes it very easy for dirt and debris to stick to and clog up the coil's air passages. Additionally, coils are great places for mold development that can further obstruct airflow.
fdd_rule.possible_solution:
1.Inspect the cooling coil for cleanliness and check any deposited particles and impurities. 
 2.Wash and clean the cooling coil

fdd_rule.name: Cooling Coil Clogged
fdd_rule.description: Cooling coil airflow pressure drop much higher than the threshold (Only a small fraction of airflow passes through)
fdd_rule.problem: 1. Reduced airflow due to dirt and debris blockages means reduced comfort for end user. 2. The blower must work harder and use more electricity to pull airflow through the blocked coil passages. 3. A dirty coil can contaminate supply ducts and reintroduce contaminants to spaces, including mold development and spores.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: During the cooling process, condensate forms on the coil. The condensate makes it very easy for dirt and debris to stick to and clog up the coil's air passages. Additionally, coils are great places for mold development that can further obstruct airflow.
fdd_rule.possible_solution:
1.Inspect the cooling coil for cleanliness and check any deposited particles and impurities. 
 2.Wash and clean the cooling coil

fdd_rule.name: Fan VFD power usage high Alarm
fdd_rule.description: Supply Fan consuming more power than normal
fdd_rule.problem: Increased energy usage for delivering the same output. Hence, loss of fan efficiency.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: There may be several reasons for increased power usage of fans including dirty or clogged air filters and coils, fan motor ageing etc.

fdd_rule.name: Chilled Water Strainer needs cleaning
fdd_rule.description: Chilled water strainer (wire mesh) clogged with debris (Chilled water flow reduced)
fdd_rule.problem: Reduces the chilled water flow, which reduces the ability of the air handler to transfer heat. Hence, reducing the efficiency of the air handling unit.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: The strainer removes the rust and mud from the chilled water system. With time, as the openings in the wire mesh are covered with debris, the strainer begins to offer more resistance to water flow.
fdd_rule.possible_solution:
1.Check if the chilled water flow pressure drop has increased significantly 
 2.Blow down of the strainer needs to be done

fdd_rule.name: Exhaust Fan TE18_1 Hi Discharge Alarm
fdd_rule.description: Exhaust fan air discharge pressure higher than limit
fdd_rule.problem: null
fdd_rule.possible_causes: null

fdd_rule.name: Exhaust FanTE18_1 Low Suction Low Alarm
fdd_rule.description: Exhaust fan air suction pressure lower than limit
fdd_rule.problem: Exhaust fan air suction pressure lower than limit
fdd_rule.possible_causes: null

fdd_rule.name: Supply Fan High Discharge Alarm
fdd_rule.description: Supply fan air discharge pressure higher than limit
fdd_rule.problem: Discharge pressure in the supply fan is higher than the threshold value
fdd_rule.possible_causes: null

fdd_rule.name: Supply Fan Low Suction Alarm
fdd_rule.description: Supply fan air suction pressure lower than limit
fdd_rule.problem: This leads to over working of the fan motor leading to more power consumption and may also lead to high motor temperatures.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: This issue can occur if the fan is starved for air. This can occur due to increased air pressure drop at filter or cooling coil or closed damper.

fdd_rule.name: Bag Filter Alarm
fdd_rule.description: The pressure drop across bag filter is higher than threshold limit indicating dirty/clogged bag filter
fdd_rule.problem: Dirty/Clogged air filters lead to excessive air pressure drop resulting in reduced airflow, increased energy consumption by the fan and depositing dirt/debris on cooling coil, ducts etc.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: As the outside air contains lot of dust and other pollution particles, the filter being the first line of defense for the AHU, gets the maximum dirt/debris buildup.

fdd_rule.name: High Chilled water Delta T
fdd_rule.description: High Chilled water Delta T
fdd_rule.problem: End user discomfort
fdd_rule.possible_causes: High chilled water delta T indicates insufficient flow to the evaporator coil of the OHU which can cause cooling issues.

fdd_rule.name: Low Chilled water delta T
fdd_rule.description: Low Chilled water delta T
fdd_rule.problem: End user discomfort
fdd_rule.possible_causes: low delta T indicates high CHW flow to coils per TR. This is a serious issue as this may be leading to energy wastage in secondary CHW pumps.

fdd_rule.name: Supply air humidity higher than setpoint
fdd_rule.description: Supply air humidity higher than setpoint
fdd_rule.problem: End user may feel stufiness or uneasiness due to high humidity. It is also bad for electronic devices in the space.
fdd_rule.possible_causes:
1.Faulty sensor
2.Check for control logic

fdd_rule.name: Supply air humidity lower than setpoint
fdd_rule.description: Supply air humidity lower than setpoint
fdd_rule.problem: End user may feel excessive dryness on the body and may lead to uneasiness and respiratory issues.
fdd_rule.possible_causes:
1.Faulty sensor
2.Check for control logic

fdd_rule.name: DDC panel ventilation fan not working
fdd_rule.description: DDC panel ventilation fan not working
fdd_rule.problem: If DDC panel temperature becomes too high (due to failure or absence of panel ventilation fan), it can effect the electronic circuitry and the system may shutdown.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Ventilation fan malfunction

fdd_rule.name: VFD heat sink temperature excessively high
fdd_rule.description: VFD heat sink temp. more than threshold
fdd_rule.problem: If VFD heat sink temperature is higher than tolerable limit, it can effect the electronic circuitry of the VFD.
fdd_rule.possible_causes: Running in high frequency all the time
fdd_rule.possible_solution: Prefer logical VFD operation for ramp up and down
